text.0:
Posts on Facebook use a photo of former president Barack Obama kissing Nancy Pelosi to support the claim that the House Democratic leader is a drunk. This is false. #FakeNews #NancyPelosi #BarackObama

https://t.co/4HthAt9oE9
text.1:
An image making the rounds on Facebook claims to show former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton shaking hands with late al-Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden. This is false. #FakeNews #HilaryClinton #OsamaBinLaden

https://t.co/0UNmG30fz9
text.2:
While Facebook has taken repeated measures to combat the spread of misinformation and conspiracy theories, researchers have called into question the algorithm which seemingly promotes fake news. #FakeNews #Facebook 

https://t.co/sjVm6AfCky
text.3:
A claim that Iceland's government will provide a monthly grant of US$5,000 to male immigrants who marry Icelandic women due to a shortage of male citizens. The claim is false. #FakeNews #Iceland #immigration 

https://t.co/LEh3Ii9EoE
text.4:
A video from #Yemen in 2019 when crowds gathered to celebrate the birth of Prophet Mohammed is viral with false claims, all linking it to the recent incident where a school teacher was beheaded by a radical islamist. #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews #SamuelPaty 

https://t.co/2mPWRjKbF4
text.5:
A video by Alex Jones falsely claiming the coronavirus outbreak is a hoax has been viewed more than one million times. #FakeNews #COVID19 #coronavirus #CoronaVirusFacts

https://t.co/2Xmfgc7Htk
text.6:
French football player @paulpogba has rubbished media reports which claimed that he had quit the national team in protest against President Emmanuel Macron's recent comments on Islam. #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews #EmmanuelMacron 

https://t.co/V1KhL1T0Mc
text.7:
A 2017 clip showing #Emmanuel_Macron being splattered with an egg on his head, is being shared online falsely linking it to the French president's recent remarks defending free speech following the death of high school teacher Samuel Paty. #FakeNews

https://t.co/dGVRBTEb7D
text.8:
A set of old and unrelated photos from Pakistan and Syria are viral on social media with false captions claiming that they show the condition of a 'civil-war torn Karachi'. #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews #CivilWarInKarachi

https://t.co/9T5aQdQzkr
text.9:
An old poster depicting a scene from Mahabharata, which was earlier viral with claims that it is an advertisement by fashion e-commerce company #Myntra, has resurfaced with captions urging people to uninstall its mobile app. #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews

https://t.co/KNBN8PieLm
text.10:
Delhi Youth Congress' official Twitter handle revived an old CCTV footage of a brutal attack on a woman inside an elevator in Malaysia and falsely claimed the assault took place inside a Delhi Metro elevator. @DelhiPYC #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews #DelhiMetro

https://t.co/QLS4Teievq
text.11:
The #SupremeCourt on Tuesday transferred all proceedings related to the #HathrasIncident before the Allahabad High Court. The SC further decided that the CBI—which is probing the case—will henceforth submit all its status reports to the High Court.

https://t.co/b9jOOJwv12
text.12:
A set of three images from Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 2019 rally in Patna, Bihar is viral on social media with captions claiming them to be from his recent 12-rally campaign for the forthcoming #BiharElections. #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews

https://t.co/9c8jMu7wEK
text.13:
The SC transferred all proceedings related to the #HathrasCase before the Allahabad HC. The #CBI which will probe the incident will submit all status reports there. The plea seeking a transfer of the trial to Delhi will be decided after the probe is complete. 

@boomlive_in
text.14:
A black-and-white picture of a man being flogged by a uniformed policeman is circulating online with captions falsely claiming that the picture shows freedom fighter #BhagatSingh being whipped by a British police officer. #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews 

https://t.co/HU5k11A7Fa
text.15:
BOOM found that the woman in the video is not Annies Kanmani Joy. BOOM fact checked the same video recently when it was viral with captions falsely identifying her as the Hathras victim in Uttar Pradesh. #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews #Kodagu

https://t.co/i2jXPbNMQZ
text.16:
A disturbing video from Pakistan showing a Maulvi molest a minor girl is being widely shared by several Facebook and Twitter users in India without stating that the video is old and not from here. #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews 

https://t.co/u4Y6n59QmH
text.17:
@TarekFatah A nearly 3-year-old-year-old clip showing protests & counter-protests against the decision to close a prayer hall in Clichy, Paris is being revived & shared after a French teacher was decapitated for showing cartoons of the prophet Mohammed to his class.

https://t.co/WCMdPtUSmd
text.18:
A nearly 3-year-old clip showing protests and counter-protests against the decision to close a prayer hall in Clichy, #Paris is being revived and shared after a French teacher who was decapitated for showing cartoons of the prophet Mohammed to his class.

https://t.co/WCMdPtDhuF
text.19:
A viral YouTube video of a panel of doctors& activists from Europe peddles #coronavirus misinformation by equating the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak to that of a normal flu & suggesting that #COVID19 is hyped & people don't need to fear this outbreak. #FakeNews

https://t.co/dIpKX0y1A2
text.20:
A mischievously cropped screenshot of 2016 article by The Wire is circulating online falsely claiming the news website referred to the festival of Durga puja as 'racist' and called the Hindu goddess a 'sex worker'. #BOOMFactCheck #FakeNews #DurgaPuja2020

https://t.co/1m4WCjr4A5
text.21:
Good morning, India. This is our top read today:
A viral WhatsApp message falsely attributed to #BillGates explains why India is not a superpower & is critical of people who spend on religious rituals & urges people to offer practical help to those in need
